title: The DAO Hack
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The DAO Hack.

hook.text: In 2016, hackers exploited a smart contract bug and drained $60 million from Ethereum's most ambitious project.

buildup.text: The DAO was a decentralized investment fund. People deposited Ether to vote on which projects to fund.

discovery.text: A flaw in the code let an attacker drain funds repeatedly before the contract could update its balance.

twist.text: Ethereum's community voted to rewrite history â€” reversing the hack by forking the entire blockchain.

climax.text: Purists refused. They kept the original chain, calling it Ethereum Classic. Two Ethereums now exist.

punchline.text: They reversed a hack by rewriting blockchain history. Not everyone agreed.

quiz.question: What happened after the DAO hack?
options: The community forked the blockchain, creating Ethereum Classic
